definitions: completely level or even with another surface without indentation
having a red or pink color in the face from emotion, heat, or health
having plenty of something, especially money; well-supplied or abundant
examples: The door sits flush against the wall frame
Make sure the tiles are flush with each other
Her cheeks were flush with excitement after winning
His face became flush from the intense heat
The company is flush with cash after the merger
We're flush with fresh vegetables from the garden

definitions: having a red or pink color in the face from emotion, exertion, or heat
feeling excited, animated, or elated, especially from success or pleasure
examples: Her flushed cheeks betrayed her embarrassment
He looked flushed after running up the stairs
The team was flushed with victory after the championship
She felt flushed with pride at her achievement

definitions: of, relating to, or occurring in a river or stream and its environment
examples: The fluvial deposits contain ancient fossils
Scientists study fluvial erosion patterns in the canyon
Fluvial processes shaped this valley over millennia
The region shows extensive fluvial landforms

definitions: fashionable, stylish, or cool in appearance or manner; impressive
examples: That new jacket looks really fly on you
She always wears the most fly sneakers
His dance moves are incredibly fly
The party was fly with great music

definitions: moving or capable of moving through the air with wings or mechanical means
done or performed very quickly, hastily, or while in motion
examples: The flying birds migrated south for winter
A flying insect landed on the flower
She made a flying visit to check on them
He took a flying leap over the fence

definitions: producing or covered with foam, froth, or bubbles on the surface
examples: The foaming waves crashed against the rocks
Add the foaming cleanser to warm water
His foaming mouth indicated rabies infection
The foaming beer overflowed from the glass

definitions: relating to or being the center of interest, activity, or attention
examples: The focal point of the painting draws your eye
She became the focal figure in the movement
The focal area needs immediate medical attention
This is the focal issue we must address

definitions: directing attention or effort concentrated on a particular point or purpose
having clear goals and determination; not easily distracted from objectives
examples: She remained focused during the difficult exam
Keep your eyes focused on the target
He's very focused on advancing his career
The company needs a more focused strategy

definitions: directing attention or effort concentrated on a particular point or purpose
having clear goals and determination; not easily distracted from objectives
examples: She remained focussed during the difficult exam
Keep your eyes focussed on the target
He's very focussed on advancing his career
The company needs a more focussed strategy

definitions: relating to or characteristic of a fetus during prenatal development
examples: The foetal position helps conserve body heat
Doctors monitored the foetal heartbeat carefully
Foetal development occurs in three trimesters
The foetal tissue showed normal growth patterns

definitions: filled with or characterized by thick mist or fog that reduces visibility
unclear, confused, or vague in mind or understanding; lacking mental clarity
examples: The foggy morning made driving dangerous
London often has foggy weather in autumn
My memory is foggy about those events
He felt foggy after taking the medication

definitions: prevented from achieving a goal or carrying out a plan; thwarted
examples: The foiled robbery attempt made headlines
Their foiled plans led to frustration
The foiled assassination shocked the nation
Police foiled the kidnapping at the last moment

definitions: capable of being folded or bent for storage or portability
examples: The foldable chair fits easily in the car
She bought a foldable phone screen
This foldable table saves space in small apartments
The foldable bicycle is perfect for commuters

definitions: designed to bend or fold for compactness or storage convenience
examples: He sat on a folding chair at the picnic
The folding door separated the two rooms
She carried a folding umbrella in her bag
The folding screen provided privacy

definitions: having a friendly, informal, simple manner typical of rural or small-town life
examples: His folksy charm won over the voters
The restaurant has a folksy atmosphere
She adopted a folksy speaking style for the campaign
The folksy wisdom resonated with the audience

definitions: coming after or next in time, order, or sequence
about to be mentioned or listed; that will be specified next
examples: The following day brought unexpected news
In the following years, much changed
Please complete the following tasks today
The following people should report immediately

definitions: having affection, liking, or love for someone or something
foolishly optimistic or naive; based on wishful thinking rather than reality
examples: She's very fond of classical music
He grew fond of his new neighbors
That's just fond hope with no basis
His fond belief proved completely wrong

definitions: engaging in playful behavior or joking; not being serious
examples: Stop fooling around and get to work
The kids were just fooling with each other
No fooling remarks during the serious meeting
Their fooling behavior annoyed the teacher

definitions: lacking good sense, judgment, or discretion; unwise or imprudent
examples: It was foolish to go out without a coat
She made a foolish decision to quit
He felt foolish after realizing his mistake
Don't be foolish with your money

definitions: having feet of a specified kind or number, used in combinations
examples: The sure-footed mountain goat climbed easily
She's very light-footed when she dances
The four-footed animal ran across the field
He remained flat-footed during the surprise

definitions: free to go where one likes and do as one pleases; without commitments
examples: After graduation, she was footloose and fancy-free
The footloose traveler explored many countries
He enjoyed his footloose lifestyle for years
Being footloose appeals to young adults

definitions: not allowed or permitted by rules, law, or authority; prohibited
examples: Smoking is forbidden in this building
The forbidden fruit tempted them greatly
They entered the forbidden zone despite warnings
Such behavior is strictly forbidden here

definitions: having an unfriendly, threatening, or frightening appearance that discourages approach
examples: The castle had a forbidding appearance
His forbidding expression scared the children
The forbidding mountains loomed ahead
She gave him a forbidding look

definitions: done or produced with effort, against one's will, or under pressure
lacking naturalness or spontaneity; artificially produced or strained
examples: The forced confession was later retracted
They made a forced landing in the field
Her forced smile didn't hide her sadness
His forced laughter sounded very awkward

definitions: strong, powerful, and assertive in expression, personality, or physical action
examples: She made a forceful argument for change
His forceful personality dominated the meeting
The forceful wind knocked down trees
He used forceful strokes in his painting

definitions: done by force, especially physical force; involving the use of violence
examples: The forcible entry alarmed the residents
Police prevented forcible removal of protesters
There was evidence of forcible restraint
The forcible takeover shocked everyone

definitions: situated at or toward the front; in a prominent forward position
examples: The fore section of the ship was damaged
Issues came to the fore during discussion
The fore legs of the horse were injured
This problem is now at the fore

definitions: giving a feeling that something bad or unpleasant will happen; ominous
examples: The foreboding clouds signaled an approaching storm
She had a foreboding sense about the trip
The foreboding atmosphere made everyone nervous
His foreboding expression worried his family

definitions: mentioned, described, or occurring before in a text or discussion
examples: The foregoing analysis shows clear trends
Based on the foregoing facts, we conclude
The foregoing paragraphs explain our position
All foregoing statements remain valid

definitions: having an outcome that is certain or predetermined before it happens
examples: The election result was a foregone conclusion
His promotion seemed a foregone certainty
Victory was foregone given their preparation
The foregone outcome disappointed nobody

definitions: made or done with the palm of the hand facing forward in sports
examples: Her forehand shot won the tennis match
He has a powerful forehand drive
The forehand stroke needs more practice
She prefers forehand returns over backhand

definitions: from, in, or characteristic of a country other than one's own
strange, unfamiliar, or not belonging naturally to a place or situation
examples: She studied foreign languages at university
The foreign minister arrived yesterday
Such behavior was foreign to his nature
The concept seemed foreign to them

definitions: most important, prominent, or notable in rank, position, or importance
examples: She is the foremost expert on this topic
Safety is our foremost concern
He was among the foremost scientists of his time
The foremost priority is public health

definitions: relating to or used in courts of law or legal proceedings
relating to scientific methods of investigating crimes through physical evidence
examples: The forensic evidence proved his innocence
She works as a forensic accountant
The forensic team examined the crime scene
Forensic analysis revealed crucial details

definitions: able to be predicted or anticipated based on current knowledge or circumstances
examples: There are no problems in the foreseeable future
All foreseeable risks have been addressed
The foreseeable consequences worried the board
Changes are unlikely for the foreseeable period

definitions: giving an advance hint or warning of what will happen later
examples: The foreshadowing events hinted at tragedy
Dark clouds were foreshadowing the storm
Her foreshadowing remarks proved prophetic
The foreshadowing scene set up the climax

definitions: covered with forest or trees; having extensive woodland growth
examples: The forested mountains provide wildlife habitat
They hiked through heavily forested areas
The forested region spans thousands of acres
Once forested land was cleared for farming

definitions: lost or given up as a penalty for wrongdoing, breach of rules, or failure
examples: The forfeit game counted as a loss
His forfeit property went to the state
The forfeit deposit won't be returned
Their forfeit rights cannot be restored

definitions: lost or surrendered as a penalty for wrongdoing or breach of conditions
examples: The forfeited funds went to charity
His forfeited rights were never restored
The forfeited match disappointed the fans
Their forfeited deposit covered the damages

definitions: shaped by heating metal and hammering it into form
created or developed through great effort, determination, or difficult circumstances
made as a fraudulent copy or imitation, especially of documents or signatures
examples: The forged steel blade was incredibly strong
These forged tools will last for decades
Their forged friendship survived many challenges
A forged alliance united the nations
The forged signature fooled the bank
Police discovered forged passports

definitions: apt to forget things; having a poor memory or being absent-minded
examples: He's become more forgetful with age
Don't be forgetful about your appointment
Her forgetful nature causes daily problems
The forgetful student lost his homework again

definitions: not memorable or worth remembering; easily forgotten due to being unremarkable
examples: The movie was pleasant but ultimately forgettable
It was a forgettable performance by the actor
The forgettable meal disappointed the food critics
Most meetings are fairly forgettable events

definitions: willing to forgive others; showing mercy or compassion toward wrongdoing
allowing room for error or imperfection; not requiring exactness
examples: She has a forgiving nature toward others
He was forgiving of their mistakes
This recipe is forgiving of measurement errors
The forgiving terrain suits beginning hikers

definitions: no longer remembered, known about, or considered; having passed from memory
examples: The forgotten heroes deserve recognition
She found a forgotten letter in the attic
His forgotten promise came back to haunt him
These forgotten traditions should be revived

definitions: divided into two or more branches or parts, resembling a fork shape
examples: The forked road required a choice of direction
A forked tongue flicked from the snake
The forked lightning illuminated the sky
He stood at the forked path

definitions: pitifully sad, lonely, and abandoned; appearing isolated and unhappy
examples: The forlorn puppy waited at the shelter
She looked forlorn after everyone left
A forlorn hope kept them going
The forlorn house stood empty for years

definitions: following established conventions, rules, or ceremony; characterized by strict observance of forms
official, ceremonial, or explicitly stated rather than informal or implied
examples: She wore formal attire to the gala
His formal manner made others uncomfortable
They received a formal invitation
The formal agreement was signed yesterday

definitions: made official or legitimate by establishing in a formal or legal manner
examples: The formalised procedures improved efficiency
Their formalised relationship surprised no one
The formalised rules govern all members
A formalised system replaced informal practices

definitions: made official or legitimate by establishing in a formal or legal manner
examples: The formalized procedures improved efficiency
Their formalized relationship surprised no one
The formalized rules govern all members
A formalized system replaced informal practices

definitions: having an important and lasting influence on the development of something or someone
examples: His formative years were spent in Paris
Reading was a formative experience for her
The formative stages determine final outcome
These formative influences shaped his worldview
